channel.title: NoSQL on Foo Bar Baz
channel.description: Recent content in NoSQL on Foo Bar Baz

item.title: Azure Cosmos DB: Use Cases and Trade-Offs
item.description: Azure Cosmos DB is a fully managed, elastically scalable and globally distributed database with a multi-model approach, and provides you with the ability to use document, key-value, wide-column, or graph-based data.

item.title: An easy to use monitoring solution for Redis
item.description: Recently, I discovered a nice way of plugging in monitoring for Redis using Grafana, thanks to this great Data Source plugin that works with any Redis database, including Azure Cache for Redis!

item.title: Getting started with Rust and Redis
item.description: Are you learning Rust and looking for ways to get some hands-on practice with concrete examples? A good approach might be to try and integrate Rust with external systems.

item.title: How to use Azure Go SDK to manage Azure Data Explorer clusters
item.description: Getting started with Azure Data Explorer using the Go SDK covered how to use the Azure Data Explorer Go SDK to ingest and query data from azure data explorer to ingest and query data.

item.title: Tutorial: Getting started with Azure Data Explorer using the Go SDK
item.description: With the help of an example, this blog post will walk you through how to use the Azure Data explorer Go SDK to ingest data from a Azure Blob storage container and query it programmatically using the SDK.

item.title: Data pipeline using MongoDB and Kafka Connect on Kubernetes
item.description: In Kafka Connect on Kubernetes, the easy way!, I had demonstrated Kafka Connect on Kubernetes using Strimzi along with the File source and sink connector.
